articles.content: The authors hope that this experiment will shed light on one of the most perplexing aspects of accretion disks: how does a black hole grow if material remains in a stable orbit around the event horiz… [+1532 chars]

articles.title: Cosmic Tidal Wave: Star Creation in the Tendrils of the Jellyfish Galaxy JW39 - SciTechDaily
articles.description: The Jellyfish galaxy JW39, located in a hostile galaxy cluster, is exposed to intense gravitational forces and a hot plasma known as the intracluster medium. These conditions strip JW39 of its star-forming gas, creating trailing ribbons of star formation. How…
articles.content:
ByESA/HubbleMay 21, 2023
